name: Four Roses Small Batch Bourbon
description: Four original Bourbon recipes have been expertly selected by our Master Distiller at the peak of maturation to create this very mellow and perfectly balanced Bourbon.
tastingNotes:
Nose: Mellow spice, rich fruit, hints of sweet oak and caramel.
Palate: Mellow, ripened red berries, dried spice, well balanced, rich.
Finish: Soft, smooth and pleasantly long.
mashbill: Two mash bills, and a blend of four recipes. OBSK (Rye Spice), OESK (Baking Spice), OBSO Fruity, OESO Fruity Vanilla

name: Hirsch - The Horizon Bourbon
description: This first expression reflects the brand’s philosophy of curating the best American whiskey and celebrates ‘The Spirit of the Journey.’
tastingNotes: On the nose, THE HORIZON offers a classic bourbon profile with sweet cornbread and vanilla. The palate is balanced with warm notes of cinnamon and oak, followed by a long finish with slight lingering sweetness.
mashbill: 94% of the blend is from a mash bill of 75% corn, 21% rye, 4% malted barley aged 5 years 4 months; 6% is from a high-rye mash aged 6 years 2 months for added complexity.

name: High West American Prairie Bourbon
description: Our American Prairie is a carefully crafted blend of straight bourbons at least 2 years old, making a great sipper and thoughtful person’s whiskey. High West supports the American Prairie Foundation.
tastingNotes:
Nose: Light caramel and sweet vanilla.
Palate: Rich and earthy on the palate with well balanced flavors of candy corn, honey nougat and sweet corn bread biscuits.
Finish: Vanilla with a hint of caramel apple,
mashbill: Three straight bourbon whiskeys aged 2 to 13 years. 75% corn, 21% rye, 4% barley malt from MGP; 84% corn, 8% rye, 8% malted barley from undisclosed source.

name: Lone Elm Straight Wheat
description: Soft winter wheat transformed by American white oak barrels and intense Texas sun to deliver a mellow and sweet spirit with a hearty finish hinting of vanilla and dried cherries.
tastingNotes: Oak, vanilla, black cherry, dark chocolates and caramels.
mashbill: 90% Texas red winter wheat and 10% malted barley

name: Pure Kentucky Bourbon
description: Aptly named, because when you think of Kentucky, you think Bourbon. First barrel in 1937, uses limestone water and owned by Willet Family Distillery.
tastingNotes: The nose is toffee, fruit, eucalyptus and oak. The palate is cinnamon, toffee, caramel, pepper, oak, and spices.
